name: Marty Robbins -  Gunfighter Ballads & Trail Songs Quiz | Music | 15 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of the beautiful girl who dances in the cantina and wins the heart of the tragic young cowboy at the centre of the song in "El Paso"?
questions.explanation:
Felina.

	That's just an easy one to get you started. Much later there was a sequel to "El Paso" where we learn the story from Felina's point of view.

questions.text: The story of "Big Iron" concerns the hunting down of an outlaw by a ranger. From which state does the ranger come?
questions.explanation:
Arizona.

	The outlaw was called Texas Red. He had already killed twenty men. The Arizona ranger wouldn't be "too long in town".

questions.text: Complete this line from "Cool Water". "The shadows ...."
questions.explanation:
sway and seem to say.

	"Keep a-movin' Dan, don't you listen to him..."  This is a song of a hope not quite realised. They never do seem to reach the "cool, clear water".

questions.text: In the song "In the Valley" which two things does he say he is "as sad as" ?
questions.correct: the willow tree and the cold wind
options: the willow tree and the morning glory vine
the sighing wind and the coyote's call
the girl's  weeping and the night-bird's call
questions.explanation:
the willow tree and the cold wind.

	The willow weeps in the valley and the cold wind is making a sad noise in the tree-tops. It is all about waiting for her return. "I will be lonesome until you return".

questions.text: In "Running Gun" from which town is he running way and in which town does he meet his fate?
questions.explanation:
Kansas City and Amarillo.

	The cowboy is doomed. His last words to the bounty hunter are to ask him to tell his woman that "A woman's love is wasted when she loves a running gun."

questions.text: In "The Master's Call" what crime was the young outlaw involved in when he heard the "Master's Call"?
questions.explanation:
cattle rustling.

	He gets caught in a storm and the cattle stampede towards him. A second flash of lightning kills some of the cattle which form a barricade and save him. In return he vows to give "his life and soul" to God and a new way of life.

questions.text: In "The Little Green Valley" which bird sings out a song of welcome to him?
questions.explanation:
a mockingbird.

	It's just one of the pleasures that come to his mind when he thinks of the place that he must regard as home. He is waiting for the candle to be lit and to meet someone at the garden gate. But is it all a memory or a hopeless dream?

questions.text: In "A Hundred and Sixty Acres" what is "jingling in my jeans"?
questions.explanation:
pocket money.

	Happiness is a small plot of land that you can call your own. It doesn't matter if you get up at dawn and work all day.

questions.text: "Billy the Kid" tells the story of the famous young killer. Which is the last line of Marty's version of this song?
questions.correct: They'll lose their lives in the very same way.
options: The young outlaw's life has now come to an end.
Shot down by Pat Garrett who once was his friend.
Just like poor Billy they wander astray.
questions.explanation:
They'll lose their lives in the very same way.

	All these lines come at the end of the song but the correct one points out the moral of the story and how you will end if you don't take the chance "to be square".

questions.text: What is the name of the girl in "They're hanging me tonight"?
questions.explanation:
Flo.

	It seems an unlikely name for a heroine but this contraction of "Florence" is a useful one syllable word to fit to the tune of the song.

questions.text: In "Utah Carol" what is the colour of the blanket?
questions.explanation:
red.

	Scientists say that cattle can't see colours and so the explanation for why the frightened cattle charged the red blanket must be that it was being waved about and that agitated them. The story ends with Utah Carol being buried in the blanket that caused his death.

questions.text: What is the name of the boss's daughter in "Utah Carol"?
questions.explanation:
Lenore.

	In this story Lenore is just a young girl and a friend whose life is saved by Utah Carol when he sacrifices his own life in the face of a charging stampede of cattle.

questions.text: How much will the "bronc fighter" get paid to ride "The Strawberry Roan" for a "couple of days"?
questions.explanation:
ten dollars.

	"He offered me ten and I said, "I'm your man.   The bronc never lived that I couldn't fan."    It's a proud boast that is never fulfilled. The strawberry roan proves there are "ponies that I cannot ride. There's some of them left. They haven't all died."  He's almost glad.

questions.text: Which three of the "Gunfighter Ballads and Trail Songs"  are in the "Public Domain" for nobody knows who wrote them?
questions.correct: Billy the Kid, Utah Carol, Strawberry Roan
options: The Master's Call, The Little Green Valley, Big Iron
Cool Water, Utah Carol, In the Valley
In the Valley, A Hundred and Sixty Acres, Running Gun
questions.explanation:
Billy the Kid, Utah Carol, Strawberry Roan.

	Marty Robbins wrote "In the Valley", "The Master's Call", "Big Iron", and, of course, "El Paso"."Cool Water" by Bob Nolan, "A Hundred and Sixty Acres"-Kapp, "Running Gun" -Tom Glaser and Tim Glaser.

questions.text: In which song are the lines "and why my brow is darkened like the clouds upon the hill"?
questions.explanation:
Utah Carol.

	It is strange that we will never know who came up with such a beautiful image as this which begins the sad but uplifting tale of Utah Carol.  "And now, my friends, you asked me what makes me sad and still,   And why my brow is darkened like the clouds upon the hill.   Run in your ponies closer and I'll tell to you my tale...."
